page_analysis.text_content:
Driveway standards

• Driveway surfaces may have either permeable or impermeable paving. Materials shall meet Public Works standards.
• Driveway surface within 10' of the public right-of-way may not be of a loose material e.g., gravel.
• 2nd dwelling units must share common driveway with main dwelling.

• Minimum driveway clearance: 10'
• Minimum driveway surface: 8'
• Minimum 20' between curb cuts.
• No more than 40% of required front yard may be impermeable.
• Street-work permit required for work done within the public right-of-way.

For safety reasons, the city also encourages that the following standard be met:

• No more than one curb cut per single frontage.

• Minimum of 50' between curb cut and intersection curb face.

Fig 31 Driveway standards

visual_elements.description: Three vertical driveway surface illustrations side-by-side. Left: Pavers without mortar (grass between) labeled 'OK'. Middle: 'Hollywood strips' (grass between) labeled 'OK'. Right: Gravel surface with detailed annotations indicating: 'Turns enroute to required parking spaces must be deemed maneuverable by the Transportation Division.'; '8' min. width for driveway surface (typ. all)'; '10' min. width for driveway clearance (typ. all)'; 'No gravel or similar loose materials within 10' of the public right-of-way (lot line)'; 'Work done within the public ROW requires a street-work permit and must comply with city standards.' The right diagram also shows a vertical measurement labeled '10' min' with an arrow pointing to the clearance zone.

technical_specifications.parameter: Maximum curb cuts per single frontage (recommended)
Minimum distance between curb cut and intersection curb face (recommended)
Prohibited material within 10' of public right-of-way

additional_notes: Page number 36 at bottom left corner.
Italicized text used for 'Fig 31 Driveway standards' and safety encouragement notes.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Page layout: Text arranged in two columns at top half; diagram occupies bottom half of page.

qualifiers.text: Materials shall meet Public Works standards.
For safety reasons, the city also encourages that the following standard be met:

conditions.text: Driveway surface within 10' of the public right-of-way may not be of a loose material e.g., gravel.
No more than 40% of required front yard may be impermeable.
No more than one curb cut per single frontage.
Minimum of 50' between curb cut and intersection curb face.
Street-work permit required for work done within the public right-of-way.

logical_relationships.expression: Driveway surfaces must meet all of the following: no loose material within 10' of right-of-way (c1), minimum driveway clearance 10' (c2), minimum driveway surface 8' (c3), minimum 20' between curb cuts (c4), no more than 40% impermeable front yard (c5), and street-work permit required for work within public right-of-way (c8).
For safety reasons, it is encouraged that no more than one curb cut per single frontage (c6) and minimum 50' between curb cut and intersection curb face (c7) be met.

execution_sequence.action: Verify driveway surface materials meet Public Works standards.
Ensure street-work permit is obtained for work within public right-of-way.
Encourage safety standards regarding curb cuts and intersection distances.
